intro: Andrographis macrobotrys var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-floweredandrographis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, two-lipped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. This variant is notable for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
